sentence.Network_cn: 格温德琳含着眼泪笑了笑。

sentence.Network_en: He was in the studio tearfully erasing all the tapes he'd slaved over.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在录音棚里流着眼泪抹掉他辛苦录制的所有磁带。

sentence.Network_en: She asks him tearfully how he can expect her to remain on at Thornfield under the circumstances.
sentence.Network_cn: 她两眼含泪,问他怎能指望她在这样的情形下继续留在桑菲尔德.

PerfectNetExp.abs: t.c. tre corde之缩写。tearfully〔英〕眼泪汪汪地，悲伤地。tedesca〔意〕（原意：德意志的）泰德斯卡。17世纪指阿列曼德（allemande），1880年.

list.abs: The rulers have resorted to exhortations , pleading tearfully for restored confidence ., 统治者们求助于花言巧语 , 痛哭流涕地要求恢复对他们的信任.

occasionally a passing traveler from Atlanta brought a note from Aunt Pitty tearfully begging the girls to come back .偶尔有个从亚特兰大来的过客捎来皮蒂姑妈的一张字条，她在伤心地恳求姑娘们回去。

entry.def: If someone is tearful, their face or voice shows signs that they have been crying or that they want to cry.

example.ex: She became very tearful when pressed to talk about it.
example.tran: 她被逼谈论此事时开始泪如雨下。

means.word_mean: 1. with tears; in a tearful manner;

sentences.sentence: "the man confessed tearfully to having beaten his wife"

auth_sentence.content: His love for Don Quixote is tearfully manifest.
auth_sentence.res_content: His love for Don Quixote is tearfully manifest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His love for Don Quixote is tearfully manifest.

sentences.en: She asks him tearfully how he can expect her to remain on at Thornfield under the circumstances.

sentences.en: While sitting in a coffee shop, we overheard a woman tearfully tell her husband that she was sorry that her work had been so consuming.
sentences.cn: 有一次我们坐在一个咖啡厅里，无意中听到一名妇女正流着泪对她的丈夫说，她的工作总是那么地耗精费神，这使她很歉疚。
